body:
> I would like to contribute to this issue.

Please evaluate how many libs and sizes of them before you write codes.
Familiar with the code, I think this part of the function should be written in the `storage-jdbc-hikaricp-plugin` module, like h2、 mysql, there may be some differences, is right?

> Familiar with the code, I think this part of the function should be written in the `storage-jdbc-hikaricp-plugin` module, like h2、 mysql, there may be some differences, is right?

Yes, it is. But we need to depend on the driver libs.

#1964
```
MySQL driver is NOT allowed in Apache official distribution and source codes.
Please download MySQL driver by yourself. Copy the connection driver jar to oap-libs
```
Postgreql have the same problem?
Postgreql driver should be licensed as Apache 2.0, if so, it doesn't have this issue. The MySQL driver is GPL license.

The PostgreSQL JDBC Driver is distributed under the BSD-2-Clause License. Should be no problem
https://jdbc.postgresql.org/about/license.html
Yes, according to ASF doc, https://www.apache.org/legal/resolved.html#category-a, it should be fine.

@MichaelProjects this seems to be duplicated with #5263 but also seems you had referred to it already. Can you move the grpc patch part to the top like this


```python
from gevent import monkey
monkey.patch_all()

import grpc.experimental.gevent as grpc_gevent # key point
grpc_gevent.init_gevent() # key point

config.flask_collect_http_params = True
config.logging_level = 'DEBUG'
config.disable_plugins = 'sw_tornado'
config.init(collector='X.X.X.X:11800', service='Contentservice')
agent.start()

```

Docker-compose.yml
```yaml
version: '3.8'
services:
  oap:
    image: 10.249.58.10:8081/skywalking/skywalking-oap-server:8.3.0-es7  
    container_name: oap-server-1
    restart: always
    ports:
      - 11800:11800
      - 12800:12800
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD-SHELL", "/skywalking/bin/swctl ch"]
      interval: 30s
      timeout: 10s
      retries: 3
      start_period: 40s
    environment:
      SW_STORAGE: elasticsearch7
      SW_STORAGE_ES_CLUSTER_NODES: 10.249.58.4:9200,10.249.58.5:9200,10.249.58.6:9200
      SW_STORAGE_ES_INDEX_SHARDS_NUMBER: 2
      SW_STORAGE_ES_INDEX_REPLICAS_NUMBER: 2
      SW_HEALTH_CHECKER: default
      SW_TELEMETRY: prometheus
      SW_KAFKA_FETCHER: default
      SW_KAFKA_FETCHER_SERVERS: 10.249.58.4:9092,10.249.58.5:9092,10.249.58.6:9092
      SW_KAFKA_FETCHER_PARTITIONS: 3
      SW_KAFKA_FETCHER_PARTITIONS_FACTOR: 2
      SW_KAFKA_FETCHER_ENABLE_METER_SYSTEM: "false"
      SW_KAFKA_FETCHER_IS_SHARDING: "false"
      SW_KAFKA_FETCHER_CONSUME_PARTITIONS: ${CONSUME_PARTITION}
      SW_KAFKA_HANDLER_THREAD_POOL_SIZE: -1
      SW_KAFKA_HANDLER_THREAD_POOL_QUEUE_SIZE: -1
      TZ: "Asia/Shanghai"
    volumes:
      - /etc/timezone:/etc/timezone
      - /etc/localtime:/etc/localtime
      - /usr/share/zoneinfo/Asia:/usr/share/zoneinfo/Asia
```
![error-sw](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46880610/106977320-11b82180-6795-11eb-9c86-1dacb715ac86.jpg)

docker version 19.03
docker-comose version 1.28.2
Have you used the latest(8.4.0) toolkit in your codes? Our demo env is using this right now.

I can already see demo env  the results.

1. maven config

   `  <dependency> `
             `<groupId>org.apache.skywalking</groupId> `
             `<artifactId>apm-toolkit-log4j-2.x</artifactId> `
             `<version>8.4.0</version> `
        ` </dependency>`

2. log4j2.xml config
    `    <appenders> `
          `   <Console name="Console" target="SYSTEM_OUT"> `
               `<PatternLayout pattern="%d [%traceId] %-5p %c{1}:%L - %m%n"/> `
        ` </Console> `

        ` <GRPCLogClientAppender name="grpc-log"/> `
   `  </appenders>`

3. agent.conf  add config
  `plugin.toolkit.log.grpc.reporter.server_host=${SW_GRPC_LOG_SERVER_HOST:127.0.0.1}`
  `plugin.toolkit.log.grpc.reporter.server_port=${SW_GRPC_LOG_SERVER_PORT:11800}`
 `plugin.toolkit.log.grpc.reporter.max_message_size=${SW_GRPC_LOG_MAX_MESSAGE_SIZE:10485760}`
 `plugin.toolkit.log.grpc.reporter.upstream_timeout=${SW_GRPC_LOG_GRPC_UPSTREAM_TIMEOUT:30}`

4. skywalking 8.4 the storage mode of choice is H2

Such configuration, I can print tracID in the log, but I don't have the log report effect, is there anything else that needs to be configured?
`<Console name="Console" target="SYSTEM_OUT">`, you are outputting to console? We need you to target this appender for your logs.
Take a look at our demo source codes, https://github.com/SkyAPMTest/skywalking-live-demo/blob/master/projectB/src/main/resources/log4j2.xml
I experienced it. Thanks
What do you mean? If you want to change anything, all source codes are open for you.

@xiangwangcheng for `role` and `RoleBinding`, if you don't enable Envoy ALS (or you don't know what Envoy ALS is), you can safely delete it, at this time, it takes no effect at all so leaving them there does no harm.

But SkyWalking OAP needs a service account, hence you cannot delete `oap-serviceaccount.yaml`

> @xiangwangcheng for `role` and `RoleBinding`, if you don't enable Envoy ALS (or you don't know what Envoy ALS is), you can safely delete it, at this time, it takes no effect at all so leaving them there does no harm.
> 
> But SkyWalking OAP needs a service account, hence you cannot delete `oap-serviceaccount.yaml`

Thank you for the quick reply!
The Kubernetes-client swallowed the exception stack, I bump up the version (minimal) to include https://github.com/kubernetes-client/java/pull/1164 , also added some defensive codes against NPE

> 
> @EvanLjp As k8s-client has been upgraded to 10.0. Your #5778 could continue.

That's not the case, I've checked that issue and the bug kubernetes-client/java#1344 is only included in 11.0, and there are API changes affected our uses in 11.0 so I just keep it under 11.0, when dealing with #5778 the k8s-client needs another upgrade and some APIs adjustments

I am now introducing Skywalking 0.3.0 and it is a single page application.
Excuse me, SkywalkingClient JS 0.3.0 when monitoring the browser side, when will the monitoring data be sent, and what we found was that it wasn't real time, there will be a delay of more than 20 seconds.  (like /brower/perfData), and another request (/v3/segments), What is the timing of this request?
what is the sample rate for the Skywalking Client JS 0.3.0 browser monitoring?

As this is exactly the same question with #5263 and the answer was provided, I'll close this for now, if @MichaelProjects you have any further question, feel free to continue this issue by adding comments here

Your browser may can't afford we report that data immediately, so we choose periodically.
No sampling for performance data, trace sampling rate is as same as server side tracing.

@rola0411 this is a problem of YAML file, simple string `"3"` is considered number, and SkyWalking only accepts string for this field, so you need to prevent the YAML parser from parsing `"3"` as number, you can use `SW_KAFKA_FETCHER_CONSUME_PARTITIONS: "'${CONSUME_PARTITION}'"` or `SW_KAFKA_FETCHER_CONSUME_PARTITIONS: '"${CONSUME_PARTITION}"'`, in another word, quote them twice
